intro: Sopubia welwitschii var. micrantha, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
